title: Daily Market Digest
subtitle: February 22, 2026 - Markets Closed for Weekend (Recap of February 20, 2026)

items.headline: U.S. Markets Closed for Weekend; Recap of Friday's Gains Amid Tariff Ruling and Mixed Economic Data
items.summary: U.S. stock markets are closed today, Sunday, February 22, 2026. On the last trading day, Friday, February 20, 2026, major U.S. indices finished higher, driven by a broad relief rally following the Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs. Sentiment was cautiously optimistic despite discouraging reports of slowing economic growth and accelerating inflation. Technology stocks led the gains, though trading remained tentative as investors weighed future tariff implications.

items.headline: Telix Pharmaceuticals Surges on Earnings
items.summary: Australian healthcare company Telix Pharmaceuticals Ltd. ($TLX) rocketed up 14.24% following the release of its latest earnings report, delighting the market.

items.headline: Comfort Systems Reports Strong Profit
items.summary: Comfort Systems rose 3% after the provider of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and electrical services reported a stronger profit for the latest quarter than analysts expected.

items.headline: Hindalco Leads Indian Gains
items.summary: Hindalco Industries Ltd. ($HINDALCO) was among the top gainers in the Indian NIFTY50 index, rising 3.32%.

items.headline: Akamai Technologies Suffers Sharp Decline
items.summary: Akamai Technologies ($AKAM) dropped 12.6%, marking one of the market's sharpest losses.

items.headline: Kwality Walls (India) Among Top Losers
items.summary: Kwality Walls (India) saw a significant decline of 3.01% on Friday.

items.headline: Infosys Down on Friday
items.summary: Infosys Ltd. ($INFY) experienced a decline of 1.31% during Friday's trading session.

items.headline: Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump's Tariffs, Sparks Relief Rally
items.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, leading to a broad relief rally in equity markets despite earlier concerns about slowing growth and inflation. President Trump, however, pledged to impose tariffs through other means, contributing to tentative trading.

items.headline: Mixed Economic Data: Slower Q4 GDP, Warmer PCE Figures
items.summary: Fourth-quarter 2025 GDP grew by a slower-than-expected 1.4% year over year, down from the previous quarter, partly due to a prolonged government shutdown. Conversely, December's Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) showed warmer-than-anticipated results.

items.headline: Technology and Communication Services Lead Gains; Energy Shares Run Hot
items.summary: Technology and Communication Services sectors were among the best performers on Friday, with industrials also seeing gains. Energy shares performed well, supported by rising oil prices amid U.S.-Iran geopolitical tensions. Consumer defensives, utilities, and real estate lagged.

items.headline: Major Earnings Reports Await Next Week
items.summary: Investors are looking ahead to a busy week of earnings reports, with major companies including Nvidia ($NVDA), Berkshire Hathaway ($BRK.A), Salesforce ($CRM), and Intuit ($INTU) scheduled to release their latest results.
